page.title: 20The Jolly Abbot
page.content: During the period of the survey the manager of the Jolly Abbot public house is based there in a temporary capacity. The pub's name comes from the family who owned the land on which the Abbots Farm Estate has been built, not because of any monastic connections. The pub has many regular customers. They are mainly in the age range eighteen to twenty five and a lot of them are on the dole. Those who are employed have a variety of jobs such as secretary, computer sales assistant and working in a large electrical components factory. During the winter it is mainly local people who visit the pub but in the summer many people from outside the area come to the pub to use the beer garden.
